data.title: Great park for relaxing, walking, or having a picnic.
data.text: This park is good size and has mature tree's. It is a great place to relax, take a walk or have a picnic. The Library is ajoining the park, and the police department is nearby. Good place to take a book you checked out and enjoy it!

data.title: Needs work
data.text: I used to take my kids here all the time, my mom lives close by. We would go to a one of the near by deli's and grad lunch and eat at the park but no more. The amount of homeless people is overwhelming and really sad to see.

data.title: PARK HEART OF URBAN CHULA VISTA
data.text: I really enjoy walking around this park!  Skaters love this place too!  I see people walking their dogs and remembering to pick up after them!  There are ceremonies here and this park is the "GO TO" place for family events that impact our community.  It is one block from the Police Dept so you feel safe.  I giggle because there are so many cool restaurants to eat around here, but mainly I go to walk off extra pounds and look at the flowers, family, and fun.  :)

data.title: Memorial Bowl Park is a beautiful gem in the Third Avenue Village
data.text: This is my favorite park in to visit in Central Chula Vista that is nestled in the Third Avenue Village.  I have enjoyed the park as a  place to relax in the middle of the city as well as pay tribute to our fallen heroes. You will be surprised by the handsome memorial.  The memorial is set in the middle of the park surrounded by tall swaying palm trees.  The park has a history of dating back to 1939 when the park was funded by the WPA during the Roosevelt period of our history.  Bring your camera and or smart phone for pictures.
